page.title: 02THE VILLAGE OF PEMBURY
page.content: { The Village of Pembury.} The village of Pembury is a dormitory village, with many of the inhabitants working in Tunbridge Wells. The original village laid to the north, near Lower Green. After 1820, and the first stage coaches, the centre of the village moved up to the A 21, the London to Hastings road. At this time there was a hostelry and turnpike. There was stabling in the High Street, on the Green was a wheelwrights and forge. On the site of Brednock Garage there was a carriage paint shop. The village is now sprawling, the Green only sees the occasional fete or car rally. It is a triangular shape, there are no buildings on it, just a beautiful old chestnut tree and a horse trough dedicated to the martyr, Margory Polley.
